Legal_Issue: Whether the Applicants fall under the exception to the statutory stay of removal under paragraph 49(1.1)(a) of the Immigration Act
Credibility_Assessment: Not directly assessed; intention deemed irrelevant
Evidence_Type: Travel records, duration of stay in the U.S.
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Physical presence in the U.S. for 10 days, including travel to Miami
Regulation_Cited: Paragraph 49(1.1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Review_Outcome: Applicants not entitled to statutory stay
Assessment_Standard: Definition of 'sojourn' as temporary stay regardless of intent
Application_Factor: Duration and nature of stay in the U.S.
Cause_of_Refusal: Sojourn in the U.S. disqualifies statutory stay
Credibility_Issues: Claimed transit purpose vs. actual travel activity
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that U.S. stay was merely transit
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada-U.S. border entry and refugee claims
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, paragraph 49(1.1)(a)
Procedural_Issue: Timing of judicial review and stay application
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Inapplicability of statutory stay due to sojourn
